info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 5:25AM EDT until May 28 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Marshall affecting Madison County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River At Marshall. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. The French Broad River is approaching some buildings on Blannahassett Island and approaching residential yards along Island Road. Minor flooding along Rollins Road is likely. The river is approaching the railroad tracks in the Back Street area. At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding continues. The French Broad River is close to the top of the railroad tracks and starting to flood areas between Highway 70 and the normal riverbank. Floodwaters may begin to reach buildings along Back Street and on Blannahassett Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:16 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.2 feet and rising steadily. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.9 feet this morning. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage overnight tonight. - Action/Advisory Stage is 7.5 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued Saturday morning before 800 AM EDT.
